name: INDEPENDENCE HALL PARKING, INC., Appellant, v. COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION, Appellee
name_abbreviation: Independence Hall Parking, Inc. v. Commonwealth, Department of Transportation
docket_number: Appeal No. 89 Eastern Dist. Appeal Docket, 1985

judges: Before NIX, C.J., and LARSEN, FLAHERTY, McDER-MOTT, HUTCHINSON, ZAPPALA and PAPADAKOS, JJ.
parties: INDEPENDENCE HALL PARKING, INC., Appellant, v. COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION, Appellee.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM.
AND NOW, this 31st day of March, 1986, the Commonwealth Court’s order affirming the Philadelphia Common Pleas’ denial of equitable relief is affirmed. This order is without prejudice to any other actions for non-equitable relief that appellant may institute.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

attorneys: Craig R. Shagin, Michael Sklaroff, James D. Crawford, Philadelphia, for appellant.
Andrew Cline, Harrisburg, for Dept, of Transp.
Richard D. Solo, Philadelphia, for Blara Parking Corp.— intervenor.
Stanley Shingles, Philadelphia, for Thomas, Jenkins & Patrizi.
Michael J. Stack, Philadelphia, for Provenzano.
James J. Kutz, Deputy Atty. Gen.
casebody.head_matter:
506 A.2d 896
INDEPENDENCE HALL PARKING, INC., Appellant, v. COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION, Appellee.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued Dee. 3, 1985.
Decided March 31, 1986.
Craig R. Shagin, Michael Sklaroff, James D. Crawford, Philadelphia, for appellant.
Andrew Cline, Harrisburg, for Dept, of Transp.
Richard D. Solo, Philadelphia, for Blara Parking Corp.— intervenor.
Stanley Shingles, Philadelphia, for Thomas, Jenkins & Patrizi.
Michael J. Stack, Philadelphia, for Provenzano.
James J. Kutz, Deputy Atty. Gen.
